abstract.p: Television rating for Game 1 of World Series, which New York Yankees won by 4-3 in 12 innings, produced 14.0 preliminary overnight Nielsen rating with 25 share, down 7 percent from 15.0 (26 share) for same game last year (S)

block.p: The rating for Game 1 of the Subway Series, which the Yankees won by 4-3 in 12 innings, produced a 14.0 preliminary overnight Nielsen rating with a 25 share Saturday night, down 7 percent from a 15.0 (26 share) for the same game last year.
Each overnight rating point equals 675,000 television households. The share is the percentage of televisions in use that are tuned to a particular program.

The rating for Game 1 of the Subway Series, which the Yankees won by 4-3 in 12 innings, produced a 14.0 preliminary overnight Nielsen rating with a 25 share Saturday night, down 7 percent from a 15.0 (26 share) for the same game last year.
Each overnight rating point equals 675,000 television households. The share is the percentage of televisions in use that are tuned to a particular program.

Game 1 was powered by a 41.6 rating (with a 62 share) in the New York market, which equals 2.8 million television households. New York's rating rose from a 27.5 for Game 1 last year when the Yankees played Atlanta.
But the absence of a team from a second city can be seen in the decline of the Atlanta market from a 42.3 (or 785,000 TV homes) for Game 1 last year to a 10.0 Saturday night.
